description.narrative: Climate Change Adaptation Plan. The overall goal to reduce climate change related risks throughout Moldova by strengthening institutional and technical capacities that support integrated climate change adaptation planning and programming.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Legal and policy environment for climate adaptation strengthened (adaptation mainstreamed in at least 5 policy documents) 2. Coordination mechanism for adaptation improved and fully operational 3. Key gaps of existing institutional capacities for climate change adaptation identified and assessed 4. CCA Capacity Development Plan updated and adopted by the sectors 5. Data gathering and analysis processes in place; Access to climate information improved through the development of at least two analytical tools 6. On-going training cycles established 7. On-going training cycles established 8. CCA technology needs identified in all key sectors; A CCA Technology Framework produced and linked to financing opportunities 9. Sectorial adaptation plans of health, forestry transport and energy updated 10. Phased and prioritized sectorial adaptation options in place 11. M&E system in place; Indicators developed for measuring progress 12. Sectorial CCA baseline established 13. SAP and NAP Evaluation processes in place 14. CBT included in 2020 national budget; Guidelines for CBT at sector level developed 15. Financial plan for long-term CCA exists; Climate related expenditures tracked 16. Phased and prioritized national adaptation investment options in place

comment.narrative: 1. NAP identified as NDC commitment 2. Coordination mechanism for adaptation not fully operational 3. CCA knowledge is fragmented and incomplete 4. CCA Capacity Development Plan exists, but not adopted by the sectors 5. CCA knowledge is fragmented and incomplete 6. CCA is not well understood across all institutions and society 7. Trainings and knowledge development activities are static and not ongoing 8. CCA related TNA for health, energy, water, transport and forestry sectors are outdated 9. CCA included in sectorial policies is not consistent 10. Little integration of adaptation into local planning documents 11. No formal systems in place to monitor progress on CCA over time 12. No data baseline on adaptation 13. No process to evaluate SAPs and NAP progress 14. CBT guidelines developed but not in use due to lack of funding for training 15. Implications of climate impacts on national budgets not well understood 16. Financing options for CCA are slim

1. Revision of National CC Adaptation Strategy initiated and is conducive for strengthening for legal and policy environment 2. Establishing CCA goals for the NAP process as well as development of the guide of indicators for coordination mechanism initiated to contribute to the improvement and operationalisation of coordination mechanism. 3. Institutional Capacity Assessment initiated to identify strengths, weaknesses, and gaps with respect to existing capacities for climate change adaptation, along with identification of climate related priorities and needs of assessed institutions. 4. NA 5. NA 6. NA 7. NA 8. TNA for health, energy, water, transport and forestry sectors initiated supporting identification of CCA technology needs 9. NA 10. NA 11. Development of the M&E system concept and indicators initiated to monitor progress CCA over time 12. NA 13. NA 14. NA 15. NA 16. NA

1. The progress on this indicator is on initial stage. The NAP2 project initiated the collaboration with FAO Ag-SAP project that focuses on the development of a sector adaptation plan in the agriculture sector. The time frame for achieving this indicator should be aligned with Ag-SAP project in order to develop a consolidated National Climate Change Adaptation Strategy that covers five key national sectors and will integrate the agriculture adaptation plan developed by Ag-SAP project. 2. The progress on this indicator is on initial stage. The project initiated consultations with five key national sectors in order to articulate CCA sectorial targets. Also the project actively cooperates with National Designated Authority and MARDE to establish CCA goals for the NAP process as well as development of the guide of indicators for operationalisation of coordination mechanism. 3. The progress on this indicator is on initial stage. The international expert was contracted, and recruitment of national experts are on-going. 4. NA 5. NA 6. NA 7. NA 8. The progress on this indicator is on initial stage. Recruitment of five sectorial experts for TNA process are on-going. 9. NA 10. NA 11. The progress on this indicator is on initial stage. The project actively cooperates with National Designated Authority in order to ensure MARDE’s ownership and sustainability of the M&E system. 12. NA 13. NA 14. NA 15. NA 16. NA

1.1.1 & 1.1.3 Establish the baseline situation (vulnerabilities, sectorial climate risks and climatic impact) 1.1.2. Develop the first Draft of the National Climate Change Adaptation Programme until 2030 and its Action Plan 1.1.4. Organize the first meeting of the National Commission on Climate Change and update NCCC on cross-sectorial coordination of adaptation 1.2.1.a Key institutional gaps identified and assessed 1.2.1.b CCA Capacity Development Plan developed and adopted by the sectors 1.2.2. Hydrological and meteorological observation network and institutional operational capacities to deliver user-oriented climate services assessed & Potential climate services/cluster of services initiated & The Concept of the New Law on hydrometeorological activity that includes climate services approved 1.3.1. Cross-sectorial gender analysis of the impact of climate change on vulnerable groups, with specific focus on rural women initiated 1.3.2. Knowledge Management Roadmap (strategy) completed 2.1.1. Report on identifying the methodologies and outline of gender-responsive, sector-level guidelines on climate impact and vulnerability assessments 2.2.1. Comprehensive Technology Prioritisation for Climate Change Adaptation Sectoral Reports completed 3.1.1. Operational Manual for National Commission on Climate Change completed 3.1.2. Workplan/ strategy to address gaps for at-risk assets in the Transport and Construction sectors developed 3.1.3. Adaptation plans developed for three district town 3.2.1.a Draft M&E Framework and the Roadmap for its implementation developed 3.3.2. Climate Budget tagging Framework and the Roadmap for its implementation developed

1.1.1 & 1.1.3 The baseline situation (vulnerabilities, sectorial climate risks and climatic impact) established 1.1.2. The first Draft of the National Climate Change Adaptation Programme until 2030 and its Action Plan developed and submitted to the Ministry of Environment for comments 1.1.4. The first meeting of the National Commission on Climate Change was postponed for the first quarter of 2022. 1.2.1.a Key institutional gaps identified and assessed 1.2.1.b CCA Capacity Development Plan developed 1.2.2. Hydrological and meteorological observation network and institutional operational capacities to deliver user-oriented climate services assessed & Potential climate services/cluster of services initiated & The Concept of the New Law on hydrometeorological activity that includes climate services approved 1.3.1. Cross-sectorial gender analysis of the impact of climate change on vulnerable groups, with specific focus on rural women initiated 1.3.2. Knowledge Management Roadmap (strategy) completed 2.1.1. Report on identifying the methodologies and outline of gender-responsive, sector-level guidelines on climate impact and vulnerability assessments 2.2.1 Comprehensive Technology Prioritisation for Climate Change Adaptation Sectoral Reports completed 3.1.2. Workplan/ strategy to address gaps for at-risk assets in the Transport and Construction sectors in progress. The target was not achieved since one of the experts selected for this assignment could not obtain no objection letter 3.1.3. Development of Adaptation plans for seven district towns in progress 3.2.1.a Draft M&E Framework and the Roadmap for its implementation in progress 3.3.2. Climate Budget tagging Framework and the Roadmap for its implementation developed

1.1.1. Develop CCA goals for the NAP process. Coordination mechanism for adaptation improved and fully operational 1.1.2. Submit the final Draft of the NCCA Programme until 2030 and the Action Plan to the Ministry of Environment 1.1.3. Establish CCA sectorial targets and objectives articulated in association with sectorial development plans and ministerial orders 1.1.4. Organize the first meeting of the National Commission on Climate Change and update NCCC on cross-sectorial coordination of adaptation 1.2.1.b CCA Capacity Development Plan adopted by the he National Commission on Climate Change 1.2.2. Potential climate services/cluster of services developed & The Draft of the New Law on hydrometeorological activity that includes climate services developed and submitted to the beneficiary & The Draft Regulation on hydrometeorological activity that includes climate services developed and submitted to the beneficiary 1.3.1. Cross-sectorial gender analysis of the impact of climate change on vulnerable groups, with specific focus on rural women completed 1.3.2. Knowledge Management Roadmap (strategy) approved by the NCCC & National climate change information and knowledge management portal launched 2.1.1. Gender -responsive, sector-level guidelines (manual) on climate impact and vulnerability assessments consulted with sectoral Working Group 2.1.2 Draft version of at least four training modules focused on CCIV assessment methodologies and approaches consulted with sectoral Working Group 2.2.1. Final BAEF Reports for sectoral adaptation consulted with sectoral Working Group 3.3.1. Adaptation options identified, prioritized and proposed for mainstreaming into sectorial development policies 3.1.3. Reports on mainstreaming of gender inclusive Climate Change Adaptation measures into the local development planning documents of 7 (seven) district towns 3.1.4. Trainings conducted for national consultants on mainstreaming gender equality 3.1.5 Gender responsive communication and awareness-raising strategy continuously implemented 3.2.1.a Draft M&E Framework and the Roadmap for its implementation developed and approved by the NCCC 3.3.2. Technical design of Climate Budget tagging determined
